properties.name: info
properties.description: Arbitrary properties to add to the info endpoint.

properties.name: management.auditevents.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable storage of audit events.

properties.name: management.cloudfoundry.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable extended Cloud Foundry actuator endpoints.

properties.name: management.cloudfoundry.skip-ssl-validation
properties.description: Whether to skip SSL verification for Cloud Foundry actuator endpoint security calls.

properties.name: management.endpoint.conditions.cache.time-to-live
properties.description: Maximum time that a response can be cached.

properties.name: management.endpoint.conditions.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable the conditions endpoint.

properties.name: management.endpoint.configprops.keys-to-sanitize
properties.description: Keys that should be sanitized. Keys can be simple strings that the property ends with or regular expressions.

properties.name: management.endpoint.env.keys-to-sanitize
properties.description: Keys that should be sanitized. Keys can be simple strings that the property ends with or regular expressions.

properties.name: management.endpoint.health.group
properties.description: Health endpoint groups.

properties.name: management.endpoint.health.roles
properties.description: Roles used to determine whether or not a user is authorized to be shown details. When empty, all authenticated users are authorized.

properties.name: management.endpoint.health.show-components
properties.description: When to show components. If not specified the 'show-details' setting will be used.

properties.name: management.endpoint.health.show-details
properties.description: When to show full health details.

properties.name: management.endpoint.health.status.http-mapping
properties.description: Mapping of health statuses to HTTP status codes. By default, registered health statuses map to sensible defaults (for example, UP maps to 200).

properties.name: management.endpoint.health.status.order
properties.description: Comma-separated list of health statuses in order of severity.

properties.name: management.endpoint.jolokia.config
properties.description: Jolokia settings. Refer to the documentation of Jolokia for more details.

properties.name: management.endpoint.jolokia.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable the jolokia endpoint.

properties.name: management.endpoint.logfile.external-file
properties.description: External Logfile to be accessed. Can be used if the logfile is written by output redirect and not by the logging system itself.

properties.name: management.endpoints.enabled-by-default
properties.description: Whether to enable or disable all endpoints by default.

properties.name: management.endpoints.jmx.domain
properties.description: Endpoints JMX domain name. Fallback to 'spring.jmx.default-domain' if set.

properties.name: management.endpoints.jmx.exposure.exclude
properties.description: Endpoint IDs that should be excluded or '*' for all.

properties.name: management.endpoints.jmx.exposure.include
properties.description: Endpoint IDs that should be included or '*' for all.

properties.name: management.endpoints.jmx.static-names
properties.description: Additional static properties to append to all ObjectNames of MBeans representing Endpoints.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.base-path
properties.description: Base path for Web endpoints. Relative to server.servlet.context-path or management.server.servlet.context-path if management.server.port is configured.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.cors.allow-credentials
properties.description: Whether credentials are supported. When not set, credentials are not supported.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.cors.allowed-headers
properties.description: Comma-separated list of headers to allow in a request. '*' allows all headers.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.cors.allowed-methods
properties.description: Comma-separated list of methods to allow. '*' allows all methods. When not set, defaults to GET.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.cors.allowed-origins
properties.description: Comma-separated list of origins to allow. '*' allows all origins. When not set, CORS support is disabled.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.cors.exposed-headers
properties.description: Comma-separated list of headers to include in a response.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.cors.max-age
properties.description: How long the response from a pre-flight request can be cached by clients. If a duration suffix is not specified, seconds will be used.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.exposure.exclude
properties.description: Endpoint IDs that should be excluded or '*' for all.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.exposure.include
properties.description: Endpoint IDs that should be included or '*' for all.

properties.name: management.endpoints.web.path-mapping
properties.description: Mapping between endpoint IDs and the path that should expose them.

properties.name: management.health.cassandra.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable Cassandra health check.

properties.name: management.health.couchbase.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable Couchbase health check.

properties.name: management.health.db.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable database health check.

properties.name: management.health.defaults.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable default health indicators.

properties.name: management.health.diskspace.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable disk space health check.

properties.name: management.health.diskspace.path
properties.description: Path used to compute the available disk space.

properties.name: management.health.diskspace.threshold
properties.description: Minimum disk space that should be available.

properties.name: management.health.elasticsearch.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable Elasticsearch health check.

properties.name: management.health.influxdb.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable InfluxDB health check.

properties.name: management.health.jms.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable JMS health check.

properties.name: management.health.ldap.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable LDAP health check.

properties.name: management.health.mail.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable Mail health check.

properties.name: management.health.mongo.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable MongoDB health check.

properties.name: management.health.neo4j.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable Neo4j health check.

properties.name: management.health.ping.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable ping health check.

properties.name: management.health.rabbit.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable RabbitMQ health check.

properties.name: management.health.redis.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable Redis health check.

properties.name: management.health.solr.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable Solr health check.

properties.name: management.info.build.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable build info.

properties.name: management.info.defaults.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable default info contributors.

properties.name: management.info.env.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable environment info.

properties.name: management.info.git.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable git info.

properties.name: management.info.git.mode
properties.description: Mode to use to expose git information.

properties.name: management.metrics.distribution.maximum-expected-value
properties.description: Maximum value that meter IDs starting-with the specified name are expected to observe. The longest match wins. Values can be specified as a long or as a Duration value (for timer meters, defaulting to ms if no unit specified).

properties.name: management.metrics.distribution.minimum-expected-value
properties.description: Minimum value that meter IDs starting-with the specified name are expected to observe. The longest match wins. Values can be specified as a long or as a Duration value (for timer meters, defaulting to ms if no unit specified).

properties.name: management.metrics.distribution.percentiles
properties.description: Specific computed non-aggregable percentiles to ship to the backend for meter IDs starting-with the specified name. The longest match wins, the key `all` can also be used to configure all meters.

properties.name: management.metrics.distribution.percentiles-histogram
properties.description: Whether meter IDs starting with the specified name should publish percentile histograms. For monitoring systems that support aggregable percentile calculation based on a histogram, this can be set to true. For other systems, this has no effect. The longest match wins, the key `all` can also be used to configure all meters.

properties.name: management.metrics.distribution.sla
properties.description: Specific SLA boundaries for meter IDs starting-with the specified name. The longest match wins. Counters will be published for each specified boundary. Values can be specified as a long or as a Duration value (for timer meters, defaulting to ms if no unit specified).

properties.name: management.metrics.enable
properties.description: Whether meter IDs starting-with the specified name should be enabled. The longest match wins, the key `all` can also be used to configure all meters.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.appoptics.api-token
properties.description: AppOptics API token.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.appoptics.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.appoptics.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.appoptics.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.appoptics.host-tag
properties.description: Tag that will be mapped to "@host" when shipping metrics to AppOptics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.appoptics.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.appoptics.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.appoptics.uri
properties.description: URI to ship metrics to.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.config-refresh-frequency
properties.description: Frequency for refreshing config settings from the LWC service.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.config-time-to-live
properties.description: Time to live for subscriptions from the LWC service.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.config-uri
properties.description: URI for the Atlas LWC endpoint to retrieve current subscriptions.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.eval-uri
properties.description: URI for the Atlas LWC endpoint to evaluate the data for a subscription.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.lwc-enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable streaming to Atlas LWC.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.meter-time-to-live
properties.description: Time to live for meters that do not have any activity. After this period the meter will be considered expired and will not get reported.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.num-threads
properties.description: Number of threads to use with the metrics publishing scheduler.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.atlas.uri
properties.description: URI of the Atlas server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.api-key
properties.description: Datadog API key.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.application-key
properties.description: Datadog application key. Not strictly required, but improves the Datadog experience by sending meter descriptions, types, and base units to Datadog.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.descriptions
properties.description: Whether to publish descriptions metadata to Datadog. Turn this off to minimize the amount of metadata sent.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.host-tag
properties.description: Tag that will be mapped to "host" when shipping metrics to Datadog.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.datadog.uri
properties.description: URI to ship metrics to. If you need to publish metrics to an internal proxy en-route to Datadog, you can define the location of the proxy with this.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.api-token
properties.description: Dynatrace authentication token.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.device-id
properties.description: ID of the custom device that is exporting metrics to Dynatrace.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.group
properties.description: Group for exported metrics. Used to specify custom device group name in the Dynatrace UI.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.technology-type
properties.description: Technology type for exported metrics. Used to group metrics under a logical technology name in the Dynatrace UI.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.dynatrace.uri
properties.description: URI to ship metrics to. Should be used for SaaS, self managed instances or to en-route through an internal proxy.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.auto-create-index
properties.description: Whether to create the index automatically if it does not exist.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.host
properties.description: Host to export metrics to.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.index
properties.description: Index to export metrics to.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.index-date-format
properties.description: Index date format used for rolling indices. Appended to the index name, preceded by a '-'.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.password
properties.description: Login password of the Elastic server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.timestamp-field-name
properties.description: Name of the timestamp field.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.elastic.user-name
properties.description: Login user of the Elastic server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.addressing-mode
properties.description: UDP addressing mode, either unicast or multicast.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.duration-units
properties.description: Base time unit used to report durations.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to Ganglia is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.host
properties.description: Host of the Ganglia server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.port
properties.description: Port of the Ganglia server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.protocol-version
properties.description: Ganglia protocol version. Must be either 3.1 or 3.0.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.rate-units
properties.description: Base time unit used to report rates.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.ganglia.time-to-live
properties.description: Time to live for metrics on Ganglia. Set the multi-cast Time-To-Live to be one greater than the number of hops (routers) between the hosts.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.graphite.duration-units
properties.description: Base time unit used to report durations.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.graphite.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to Graphite is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.graphite.host
properties.description: Host of the Graphite server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.graphite.port
properties.description: Port of the Graphite server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.graphite.protocol
properties.description: Protocol to use while shipping data to Graphite.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.graphite.rate-units
properties.description: Base time unit used to report rates.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.graphite.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.graphite.tags-as-prefix
properties.description: For the default naming convention, turn the specified tag keys into part of the metric prefix.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.humio.api-token
properties.description: Humio API token.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.humio.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.humio.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.humio.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.humio.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.humio.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.humio.tags
properties.description: Humio tags describing the data source in which metrics will be stored. Humio tags are a distinct concept from Micrometer's tags. Micrometer's tags are used to divide metrics along dimensional boundaries.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.humio.uri
properties.description: URI to ship metrics to. If you need to publish metrics to an internal proxy en-route to Humio, you can define the location of the proxy with this.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.auto-create-db
properties.description: Whether to create the Influx database if it does not exist before attempting to publish metrics to it.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.compressed
properties.description: Whether to enable GZIP compression of metrics batches published to Influx.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.consistency
properties.description: Write consistency for each point.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.db
properties.description: Tag that will be mapped to "host" when shipping metrics to Influx.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.password
properties.description: Login password of the Influx server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.retention-duration
properties.description: Time period for which Influx should retain data in the current database. For instance 7d, check the influx documentation for more details on the duration format.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.retention-policy
properties.description: Retention policy to use (Influx writes to the DEFAULT retention policy if one is not specified).

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.retention-replication-factor
properties.description: How many copies of the data are stored in the cluster. Must be 1 for a single node instance.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.retention-shard-duration
properties.description: Time range covered by a shard group. For instance 2w, check the influx documentation for more details on the duration format.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.uri
properties.description: URI of the Influx server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.influx.user-name
properties.description: Login user of the Influx server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.jmx.domain
properties.description: Metrics JMX domain name.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.jmx.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to JMX is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.jmx.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.kairos.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.kairos.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.kairos.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.kairos.password
properties.description: Login password of the KairosDB server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.kairos.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.kairos.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.kairos.uri
properties.description: URI of the KairosDB server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.kairos.user-name
properties.description: Login user of the KairosDB server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.account-id
properties.description: New Relic account ID.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.api-key
properties.description: New Relic API key.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.event-type
properties.description: The event type that should be published. This property will be ignored if 'meter-name-event-type-enabled' is set to 'true'.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.meter-name-event-type-enabled
properties.description: Whether to send the meter name as the event type instead of using the 'event-type' configuration property value. Can be set to 'true' if New Relic guidelines are not being followed or event types consistent with previous Spring Boot releases are required.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.newrelic.uri
properties.description: URI to ship metrics to.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.descriptions
properties.description: Whether to enable publishing descriptions as part of the scrape payload to Prometheus. Turn this off to minimize the amount of data sent on each scrape.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to Prometheus is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.pushgateway.base-url
properties.description: Base URL for the Pushgateway.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.pushgateway.enabled
properties.description: Enable publishing via a Prometheus Pushgateway.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.pushgateway.grouping-key
properties.description: Grouping key for the pushed metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.pushgateway.job
properties.description: Job identifier for this application instance.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.pushgateway.push-rate
properties.description: Frequency with which to push metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.pushgateway.shutdown-operation
properties.description: Operation that should be performed on shutdown.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.prometheus.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.signalfx.access-token
properties.description: SignalFX access token.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.signalfx.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.signalfx.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.signalfx.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.signalfx.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.signalfx.source
properties.description: Uniquely identifies the app instance that is publishing metrics to SignalFx. Defaults to the local host name.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.signalfx.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.signalfx.uri
properties.description: URI to ship metrics to.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.simple.enabled
properties.description: Whether, in the absence of any other exporter, exporting of metrics to an in-memory backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.simple.mode
properties.description: Counting mode.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.simple.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.statsd.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to StatsD is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.statsd.flavor
properties.description: StatsD line protocol to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.statsd.host
properties.description: Host of the StatsD server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.statsd.max-packet-length
properties.description: Total length of a single payload should be kept within your network's MTU.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.statsd.polling-frequency
properties.description: How often gauges will be polled. When a gauge is polled, its value is recalculated and if the value has changed (or publishUnchangedMeters is true), it is sent to the StatsD server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.statsd.port
properties.description: Port of the StatsD server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.statsd.publish-unchanged-meters
properties.description: Whether to send unchanged meters to the StatsD server.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.api-token
properties.description: API token used when publishing metrics directly to the Wavefront API host.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.batch-size
properties.description: Number of measurements per request to use for this backend. If more measurements are found, then multiple requests will be made.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.connect-timeout
properties.description: Connection timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.enabled
properties.description: Whether exporting of metrics to this backend is enabled.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.global-prefix
properties.description: Global prefix to separate metrics originating from this app's white box instrumentation from those originating from other Wavefront integrations when viewed in the Wavefront UI.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.read-timeout
properties.description: Read timeout for requests to this backend.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.source
properties.description: Unique identifier for the app instance that is the source of metrics being published to Wavefront. Defaults to the local host name.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.step
properties.description: Step size (i.e. reporting frequency) to use.

properties.name: management.metrics.export.wavefront.uri
properties.description: URI to ship metrics to.

properties.name: management.metrics.tags
properties.description: Common tags that are applied to every meter.

properties.name: management.metrics.use-global-registry
properties.description: Whether auto-configured MeterRegistry implementations should be bound to the global static registry on Metrics. For testing, set this to 'false' to maximize test independence.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.client.max-uri-tags
properties.description: Maximum number of unique URI tag values allowed. After the max number of tag values is reached, metrics with additional tag values are denied by filter.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.client.request.autotime.enabled
properties.description: Whether to automatically time web client requests.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.client.request.autotime.percentiles
properties.description: Computed non-aggregable percentiles to publish.

properties.description: Whether percentile histograms should be published.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.client.request.metric-name
properties.description: Name of the metric for sent requests.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.server.max-uri-tags
properties.description: Maximum number of unique URI tag values allowed. After the max number of tag values is reached, metrics with additional tag values are denied by filter.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.server.request.autotime.enabled
properties.description: Whether to automatically time web server requests.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.server.request.autotime.percentiles
properties.description: Computed non-aggregable percentiles to publish.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.server.request.autotime.percentiles-histogram
properties.description: Whether percentile histograms should be published.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.server.request.ignore-trailing-slash
properties.description: Whether the trailing slash should be ignored when recording metrics.

properties.name: management.metrics.web.server.request.metric-name
properties.description: Name of the metric for received requests.

properties.name: management.server.add-application-context-header
properties.description: Add the "X-Application-Context" HTTP header in each response.

properties.name: management.server.address
properties.description: Network address to which the management endpoints should bind. Requires a custom management.server.port.

properties.name: management.server.port
properties.description: Management endpoint HTTP port (uses the same port as the application by default). Configure a different port to use management-specific SSL.

properties.name: management.server.servlet.context-path
properties.description: Management endpoint context-path (for instance, `/management`). Requires a custom management.server.port.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.ciphers
properties.description: Supported SSL ciphers.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.client-auth
properties.description: Client authentication mode. Requires a trust store.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable SSL support.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.enabled-protocols
properties.description: Enabled SSL protocols.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.key-alias
properties.description: Alias that identifies the key in the key store.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.key-password
properties.description: Password used to access the key in the key store.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.key-store
properties.description: Path to the key store that holds the SSL certificate (typically a jks file).

properties.name: management.server.ssl.key-store-password
properties.description: Password used to access the key store.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.key-store-provider
properties.description: Provider for the key store.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.key-store-type
properties.description: Type of the key store.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.protocol
properties.description: SSL protocol to use.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.trust-store
properties.description: Trust store that holds SSL certificates.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.trust-store-password
properties.description: Password used to access the trust store.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.trust-store-provider
properties.description: Provider for the trust store.

properties.name: management.server.ssl.trust-store-type
properties.description: Type of the trust store.

properties.name: management.trace.http.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable HTTP request-response tracing.

properties.name: management.trace.http.include
properties.description: Items to be included in the trace. Defaults to request headers (excluding Authorization but including Cookie), response headers (including Set-Cookie), and time taken.

 CORS support is disabled.

properties.name: endpoints.cors.exposed-headers
properties.description: Comma-separated list of headers to include in a response.

properties.name: endpoints.cors.max-age
properties.description:
How long, in seconds, the response from a pre-flight request can be cached by
 clients.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.aggregate.key-pattern
properties.description:
Pattern that tells the aggregator what to do with the keys from the source
 repository. The keys in the source repository are assumed to be period
 separated, and the pattern is in the same format, e.g. "d.d.k.d". Here "d"
 means "discard" and "k" means "keep" the key segment in the corresponding
 position in the source.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.aggregate.prefix
properties.description:
Prefix for global repository if active. Should be unique for this JVM, but most
 useful if it also has the form "a.b" where "a" is unique to this logical
 process (this application) and "b" is unique to this physical process. If you
 set spring.application.name elsewhere, then the default will be in the right
 form.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.delay-millis
properties.description:
Delay in milliseconds between export ticks. Metrics are exported to external
 sources on a schedule with this delay.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.enabled
properties.description: Flag to enable metric export (assuming a MetricWriter is available).

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.excludes
properties.description: List of patterns for metric names to exclude. Applied after the includes.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.includes
properties.description: List of patterns for metric names to include.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.redis.key
properties.description:
Key for redis repository export (if active). Should be globally unique for a
 system sharing a redis repository across multiple processes.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.redis.prefix
properties.description:
Prefix for redis repository if active. Should be globally unique across all
 processes sharing the same repository.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.send-latest
properties.description:
Flag to switch off any available optimizations based on not exporting unchanged
 metric values.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.statsd.host
properties.description: Host of a statsd server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.statsd.port
properties.description: Port of a statsd server to receive exported metrics.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.statsd.prefix
properties.description: Prefix for statsd exported metrics.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.

properties.name: spring.metrics.export.triggers
properties.description: Specific trigger properties per MetricWriter bean name.

deprecation.reason: Metrics support is now using Micrometer.
